body.p: James R. Duval states that he is a citizen of said County, and well acquainted with James James also a citizen of said County, and recently a member of the 37th Ky. mounted infantry, That on the day before said James is charged with attempting to burn Wade's house, and for which he was convicted he had a conversation with said James, who told him he could not remain safely in this county oweing to gurillas that he intended to join the army again, and would start the next morning to glasgow and if he could see Maj. Martin an officer of the late regiment of said 37th and could join him, he would do so if not he would go to Louisville and then join said army, he is informed that the house of Wade is in a direction from glasgow to the Nashville & Louisville rail road, affiant stats from James' character, he is satisfied he would never have committed said offence had he not been drunk
Sworn to before me by James R. Duval March 18th 1865
W. F. Evans J. B. C. C.

J. R. Duval
affidavit
James James
